metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5012 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac, and 56.0.2924.87 for Android, allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
